author: Chris Davies

comments.message: This is a good idea.  One issue with hotels is that they use fabrics, carpets, and woods to give a sense of comfort or luxury.   An operating room, conversely, is built around non-porous, even re-sterilizable, hard smooth surfaces.  So hotels have a decontamination risk in their design:  if some body fluids from an ebola patient spill onto a carpet - how do you clean this up afterwards?  Will doctors ever use that room again?   How do you decontaminate the hotel and return it to the owners once the ebola outbreak is over?  None of these issues are insurmountable - someone just needs to repurpose/rebuild the rooms to a medical standard

Hi Chris, building on Rik's comment, is there another type of space that isn't being used in the affected areas? Perhaps one that simulates hospital space in the sense that they can be easily disinfected? Besides the physical decontamination, it is often hard to get the community to psychologically feel comfortable using these spaces again. How might we change or maintain the perceptions to be positive? Are there any sanitation technologies we can leverage? Thanks for the contribution! Good luck!

I just read the details of US military forces going to build Ebola centers. Why not just use local hotels?

The cost of any America doing anything for west africa is 100 times the price of just buying that service locally.

That should go for any idea. The cost of flying a US health care worker to Africa would pay for 20 workers in the actual country.
summary: I just read the details of US military forces going to build Ebola centers. Why not just use local hotels?You can't build Ebola centers fast enough, but millions of rooms exist in West Africa.Before the next outbreak, agreements with hotels should be in place.The cost of any America doing anything for west africa is 100 times the price of just buying that service locally.That should go for any idea. The cost of flying a US health care worker to Africa would pay for 20 workers in the actual country.But they don't exist? Well pay well and they will appear. The patients only needs hydration and feeding at the lowest level.Ambulances? Just use trucks and wagons.
title: Hotels for Hospitals
